courses.course_title: Introduction to African American Studies in Social Sciences
courses.description: S Historical and sociopolitical materials. Approaches to studying the African American experience, antecedents from African past, and special problems.
S Expository writing based on cogent analysis of African American literature, art, music, and history ideas.

courses.course_title: Selected Topics in African American Studies

courses.description: 3 Y Issues of self determination and emancipation in region. From the period of the invasions of explorers after the European renaissance to the present.
3 Introduces students to the contributions and transformations made in the music that the enslaved African brought to the western hemisphere.
3 Survey music from Morocco to South Africa using diverse media to illuminate this vast area. The concentration will be on the lifestyle of the people who create music.

courses.course_title: African American Literature to 1900- An Introduction
courses.description: Y African American literature and orature from colonial days to 1900. Slave narrative, autobiography, Wheatly, Douglass, Harper, Dunbar, Sojourner Truth.
Y African American literary practices in the twentieth century. Baldwin, Hughes, Wright, Hurston, Morrison, Naylor, and Walker.
3 Y Fiction from the Caribbean area. Hodge, Lamming, Barrett, Roumain, James, Mais, and Conde.
3 Y Fiction by leading African novelists. Achebe, Aidoo, Ba, Dadie, Head, Ngugi, Sembene, and Soyinka.
